questions.question_text:
An app builder creates an Account validation rule on the Industry field that will throw an error if the length of the field is longer than 6 characters. Another app builder creates a workflow rule with a field update that sets the industry field to technology whenever the billing city field is set to San Francisco.
What will happen the next time a sales person saves an Account with a billing city of San Francisco?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer should be C, not sure why website shows A as most voted.

If a workflow rule updates a record, order of execution:
1. Updates the record again.
2. Runs system validations again. Custom validation rules, flows, duplicate rules, processes, and escalation rules aren’t run again.
3. Executes before update triggers and after update triggers, regardless of the record operation (insert or update), one more time (and only one more time).
